title: 108_hr3802
content: The Act may be cited as the "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" and includes amendments to IDEA. The "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" includes amendments to IDEA regarding funding, with specific amounts authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2005. The "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" appropriates specific amounts for fiscal years 2006 and 2007, with funds becoming available for obligation on specific dates. The "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" appropriates specific amounts for fiscal years 2008 and 2009, with funds becoming available for obligation on specific dates. The "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" appropriates specific amounts for fiscal years 2009 and 2010, with funds becoming available for obligation on specific dates. The "Mandatory IDEA Full Funding Compromise Act" appropriates 40 percent of the determined amount for fiscal year 2011 and subsequent years, with funds becoming available on specific dates. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act requires reporting on the number of children with disabilities receiving special education services and the average per-pupil expenditure in public schools. An exception allows a reduction in expenditures for one fiscal year under certain conditions. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows for a reduction in expenditures for one fiscal year under specific conditions, such as voluntary departure of special education personnel or a decrease in the enrollment of children with disabilities. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act permits a reduction in spending for a fiscal year under certain circumstances, including the termination of providing special education to a costly program for a child with a disability who has left the agency's jurisdiction or reached the age where free appropriate public education is no longer required. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows for reduced spending in certain situations, such as when a child no longer requires special education services or when costly long-term purchases are terminated. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows reduced spending under certain circumstances, such as when funds are used for activities funded under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. Section 613(a)(2) of the IDEA is amended to remove subparagraph (C) and reclassify subparagraph (D) as (C), while also adjusting subparagraph (A)(iii) to reference only paragraph (B).
